item.title: Krafton Doubles Down On Claim That Former Subnautica 2 Executives “Abandoned” The Game
item.content:encoded:
Krafton isn’t backing down from its claims that former executives at Subnautica 2 developer Unknown Worlds had “abandoned” the game before their dismissal from the studio.

In an official response to the lawsuit filed against it by the studio’s founders, Krafton said that Charlie Cleveland and Max McGuire “abandoned their roles as studio-wide Game Director and Technical Director to focus on their personal passion projects and quit making games for Unknown Worlds entirely.” As far as former CEO Ted Gill, Krafton says that he was “focused on leveraging his operational control to maximize the earnout payment, rather than developing a successful game.”

Krafton’s response continues to allege that in July 2023, staff at Unknown Worlds, specifically Subnautica 2’s development director, had suggested that both Cleveland and McGuire were “checked out” and that they were confused about it. With both studio heads not around, Krafton says that it led to the game’s multiplayer delays from it’s original Q1 2024 release date.

By Spring 2025, the publisher says, the development team received “extensive feedback” from the internal teams which believed that Subnautica 2 wasn’t ready for a release into Early Access. Even Krafton’s CEO reportedly warned the studio heads that a “premature Early Access release of a highly anticipated sequel like Subnautica could cause irreversible harm to the entire IP franchise—pointing to the sequel to Kerbal Space Program as a prime example.”

Despite that, they say, the executives attempted to push forward the Early Access release of the game in order to hit the earnout. That’s even with comments made that at the rate of current development, the game would “be in development for 30 years”.

“Krafton, fearing how an underbaked EA Subnautica 2 would be received by both existing fans and the broader market, urged Cleveland and McGuire to return to their posts to generate a market-ready product that would not disappoint fans,” the document reads. “Cleveland and McGuire declined. In response to Krafton’s request for the Key Employees to return to lead the development of Subnautica 2, Gill stated that ‘[t]here’s no coming back to a job they didn’t have.'”

It was also said that Cleveland and McGuire claimed they would self-publish Subnautica 2 without the support of the publisher, and began secretly downloading “massive amounts of confidential information from Unknown Worlds”.

“The Key Employees’ insistence on releasing the game immediately was singularly driven by self-interest in obtaining the earnout,” Krafton says. “At every turn during development, the Key Employees were laser focused on avoiding ‘a timeline that doesn’t tank the earnout opportunity’ and scheduling the release to maximize their payments.

“Conversations throughout the post-acquisition period make clear the Key Employee’s [sic] focus was on their payday, and not on the game. As early as 2022, an employee who was due to receive a portion of the earnout stated that despite the significant delays in the game, he was confident ‘Ted [Gill] will concoct a scheme to get us that earnout.'”

There’s plenty more in the response, which you can read for yourself via Scribd.

item.title: All Madden 26 Combine Interview Answers & Unlocks
item.content:encoded:
Madden 26 brings a fresh bunch of content to enjoy, though your Combine Interview answers remain a crucial part of Superstar Mode. If you want the answers for specific unlocks, we’ve got you covered.

Superstar Mode in the Madden franchise has been a staple for years, but now, with Madden 26‘s direct links to College Football 26, it’s possible to play out a career from high school through to the NFL. Wherever you start, though, answers in the Combine Interview are extremely important.

With an array of bonuses and unlocks available in Madden 26, here’s a complete breakdown of all the questions, answers, and unlocks available.

Madden 26 Combine Interview Answers & Unlocks

Combine Interview answers for Madden 26 are varied and depend on precisely what you want to unlock, so make sure you pick wisely.

The answers ultimately come down to whether you want to boost your influence with future teammates or with your future head coach in Madden 26, both of which have their own benefits. However, some have exclusive unlocks, with a 50/50 choice.

To make things easier, we’ve put together the table below that highlights all the questions, the answers you should choose, and the unlocks available. Some questions have two or more suitable answers, providing different unlocks, so choose the one you prefer.

Additionally, some questions are specific to a certain position and won’t appear for other positions.

Which NFL team’s roster did you end up on in Madden 26? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Madden 26, check out our list of the best teams to rebuild in Franchise Mode, and take a look at the best players by position.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Football Manager 26 News Teased For Upcoming Game
item.content:encoded:
After the cancelation of Football Manager 25, developer Sports Interactive is back, teasing news for the upcoming Football Manager 26.

In a short video released on Wednesday, Sports Interactive gave players a glimpse at the “enhanced Match Day experience” from the game. They call it “just a taste of what you can expect” following the shift of the franchise to the Unity engine. At the end of the trailer, it says that a “Match Day First Look” is “coming soon”.

“[Football Manager 26] promises to propel players on an adventure to shape their footballing destiny with our most immersive and visually rich Football Manager experience to date,” Sports Interactive said. “All the story-making potential is redefined as players get ever closer to the heart of the beautiful game.”

Football Manager’s move to Unity has been a well-documented journey that led to multiple delays of Football Manager 25 only for the game to be canceled altogether.

Are you excited about the return of Football Manager? Let us know down below, and take the discussion further in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, read about just how many exhibitors will appear at the largest Gamescom event in history. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Everything Announced For Gamescom 2025: Black Ops 7, Hollow Knight: Silksong, EA FC 26, & More
item.content:encoded:
Gamescom 2025 is right around the corner, so expect a huge surge of reveals and details on some of the biggest upcoming games. If you want to know exactly what to expect, we’ve got you covered.

With E3 dead and gone, Gamescom is the ultimate annual event for gaming fans to soak up the latest news and get their hands on huge titles ahead of launch, and 2025 is shaping up to be a huge year.

From the biggest AAA titles to indie games to keep an eye out for, we’ve highlighted everything announced for Gamescom 2025 in this guide.

Games set to headline Gamescom 2025 include Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, Hollow Knight: Silksong, EA FC 26, and lots more—with surprises also set to feature.

The Gamescom Opening Night Live event will be stacked full of trailers, first-look exclusives, gameplay showcases, and special guests. This includes the reveal for Black Ops 7, the opening cinematic from World of Warcraft: Midnight, and gameplay from Resident Evil: Requiem.

With over 1500 exhibitors at the event, there is no shortage of things to look out for, though perhaps the most in-demand will be the playable demo of Hollow Knight: Silksong. Both Microsoft and Nintendo have announced playable demos on their hardware, the former including the new ROG Ally.

Konami announced that both Silent Hill F and Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater will be at Gamescom, while other partners in attendance include Ubisoft and Capcom. Nintendo also announced its attendance, having skipped Gamescom in 2025, with the Switch 2 set to be a highlight.

Meanwhile, EA FC 26 is among the titles that will be playable at Gamescom, with EA Sports ramping up marketing ahead of the worldwide release in September.

On the official Gamescom website, plenty of games are listed as featuring. We’ve got them all below, though it’s worth mentioning this doesn’t include everything, as the aforementioned Black Ops 7 and EA FC 26, for example, aren’t featured.

  • Aion 2
  • Alienware Arena
  • Anno 117: Pax Romanda
  • Another Pint
  • Atomicrops
  • Ballionaire
  • Band of Crusaders
  • Black Desert
  • Blade and Soul Heroes
  • Blue Prince

  • Cinescape VR
  • Crimson Desert
  • CrisisX
  • Daemon x Machina: Titanic Scion

  • Duet Night Abyss
  • Emergency Room Simulator
  • EONA
  • Escape From Duckov
  • Exoborne
  • Farming Simulator 25 – Highlands Fishing Expansion
  • Fata Deum
  • Fate Trigger
  • Fernbus Simulator
  • Firefighting Simulator: Ignite
  • God Save Birmingham
  • Golf With Your Friends 2
  • Guild Wars 2: Visions of Eternity
  • Heavy Cargo – The Truck Simulator
  • Heptic Arena
  • Heroes of Might and Magic: Olden Era
  • Highway Police Simulator
  • I Hate This Place
  • Incision
  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle
  • inZOI
  • John Carpenter’s Toxic Commando
  • Kingdom Two Crowns
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess
  • Life Below
  • Little Nightmares 3
  • Lootbound
  • Military Logistics Simulator
  • MIO: Memories in Orbit
  • Monsters Are Coming! Rock & Road
  • Moonlight Peaks
  • Morbid Metal
  • Nice Day for Fishing
  • Once Human
  • Onimusha: Way of the Sword
  • On the Road – The Truck Simulator
  • Pao Pao
  • Parking World
  • Park Ranger Simulator
  • Path of Exile 2
  • Planet Party Time
  • Police Simulator: Patrol Officers
  • Possible One: Lunar Industries
  • Pragmata
  • PROHIBEAST
  • Project LLL
  • Project Motor Racing
  • PUBG: Battlegrounds & Blindspot
  • RAEV: Kingdom on the Distant Shores
  • Regions of Ruin: Runegate
  • Resident Evil Requiem
  • Roadcraft
  • Rogue Point
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma
  • Seafarer: the Ship Sim
  • Sintopia
  • SKY LEGENDS – An Aeropostale Epic
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar
  • Street Fighter 6
  • SubwaySim 2
  • Sudden Strike 5
  • Supplie
  • The Blood of Dawnwalker
  • The Bus
  • The Rogue Prince of Persia
  • Time Takers
  • Tom Clancy’s The Division 2
  • Towa and the Guardians of the Sacred Tree
  • Truck & logistics Simulator
  • Warhammer 40K: Mechanicus II
  • Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2
  • Where Winds Meet
  • Winter Resort Simulator 3
  • Wraith Ops
  • WTF: Waifu Tactical Force

Opening Night Live is far from the only stream set for Gamescom, with Future Games Show, Bethesda, and Xbox all set to showcase streams too.

Expect these to be packed full of more reveals and deeper dives into announced games, with Xbox’s including Black Ops 7, Grounded 2, Ninja Gaiden 4, and the Outer Worlds 2.

Meanwhile, the main Future Games Show will be hosted by David Hayter, who plays Metal Gear Solid’s Snake, and Maggie Robertson, the actor behind Resident Evil Village’s Lady Dimitrescu.

The table below has full details on each stream, including the dates and start times.

What are you most excited to see at Gamescom? Will you be tuning in to all the streams? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

Done reading? Now take a look at the end of PUBG on Xbox One & PS4, then check out the staggering Steam sale numbers for Battlefield 6.
